website_summaries.verdict: iHome’s Outdoor SmartPlug performs well and works with a lot of smart home platforms, but the $40 price tag might seem like a lot for the functionality of just one outlet.
pros: iHome’s Outdoor SmartPlug works well and integrates with several virtual assistants and smart home platforms
cons: For $40, you’ll just get one smart outlet, and the plug itself has a bulky, unattractive design

customer_reviews.title: Look at the app reviews before buying
customer_reviews.text: I spent almost 4 hours screwing with this thing trying to get it to connect and nothing. I wish I would have searched for the app in the app store before buying because it has horrible reviews and wouldn't have had to waste half of my saturday afternoon trying to get it to connect. I took the thing inside and trying to program it 3 feet away from my router and no luck. I tried calling the iHome support and that was no help. I contacted them via email and as I leave this review (7 days later) I have not heard one thing. I would avoid this product and probably the rest of the iHome product.
customer_reviews.author: B Chop

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable for HomeKit - drops wifi connection constantly
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product but they're completely unreliable. I have two of them and have attempted to use them for outdoor holiday lights but the device constantly gives a "not connected" status in the app. The firmware is up to date (as is my iPhone XS and the iHome app) and I've checked back often over the past two years for new updates, hoping they will finally work. You might get a day or two of regular use out of them but then no response. I've had to go back to a manual outlet. Very frustrating. Save your money and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: J. JORDAN

customer_reviews.title: if you're not tech savvy find another product
customer_reviews.text: I got 2. what a pain in the neck to get connected to wifi. there are complications with having 2.5 and 5 gHz networks with same SSID. this product does not support 5 gHz, so it was getting confused about which network to connect to, and for some reason only trying to connect to the 5gHz network, even though it doesn't support it. once I figured all that out I adjusted my router settings to push devices to their more preferred network freq, and disabled 20/40 mHz coexistence, and these plugs connected fine. they work well, and are controlled seamlessly through the app and also with Alexa
customer_reviews.author: Sasquatch

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, buggy app. Won't stay connected. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Worked ok for a couple of weeks, but would randomly disconnect from app. Now it won't reconnect at all. Requires going outside to the outlet to reset, wait for it to reconnect to the app, and then still won't reconnect most of the time. Not useful for an outdoor light when the whole point of getting this was that it is not convenient to go outside in the elements to turn it on. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Krishna

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace a similar device that uses a different connection, Z-wave Plus. This other device was constantly disconnecting despite having two signal repeaters nearby. The iHome iSP100 works well, easy to install -just in few minutes. Worked perfect with Siri and Echo - but not compatible with SmartThings. The information seems confusing and at some point iHome says that is compatible but ST denies it. Why 3 stars? Because Is not compatible with at it was stated. I will keep it, anyways.
customer_reviews.author: ERiX

customer_reviews.title: Gets a bad rap
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this weren't super great but I took a shot anyways with this outdoor smart plug. I've used it thus far to control my outdoor Xmas lights for a month and only one drop from the network. I specifically got this one because of Homekit support and it worked as desired. I would buy another one if I needed another outdoor smart plug.
customer_reviews.author: J Overby

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This had made life simpler until it quit working. I've reset this multiple times, worked with "support" and basically not found the device to hold up over less than a year. It is not something I will purchase again. Very disappointed in the product and support. There are multiple other devices on the market and at first this one worked well but after 8 months of owning the product it no longer works as a wireless/app controlled device and can only be used to physical turn on/off anything. VERY DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Zero Problems with my Outdoor Smart Plug
customer_reviews.text: It's been almost a year since I bought mine. In the winter months I've used for some of my Christmas lights, in the rest of the year I use this for my patio lights. I've never lost connection once or had any other problems. Setup was very straight forward, assuming you actually read the directions and don't assume. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another based on my experience with the one I have.
customer_reviews.author: S. Howland

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few weeks then completely died
customer_reviews.text: Update to initial Review: Worked fine for a few weeks then suddenly died on me. No power to the plug what so ever. Disappointed and would not recommend. So far so good. Initial setup was simple and seems to be staying online for the time being. Please keep in mind that if the outlet is disconnected from the cord / wall outlet or you lose power, you will need to set it up again. Sucks if you have it on your roof like I do, but what are you gonna do?
customer_reviews.author: Lino412

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This is flagrant false advertising. The description of the iHome iSP100 outdoor smart plug says it works with Alexa voice control and SmartThings. In reality, it works with neither one. You can only add the iSP5, 6, and 8 to SmartThings, the iSP100 is not support. Additionally, I enabled the iHome SmartPlug Control skill for Alexa and after connecting my iHome account Alexa tells me it can't find the device.
customer_reviews.author: Kelde81

customer_reviews.title: This product sucks
customer_reviews.text: If this would stay connected to Apple HomeKit this would be awesome product. I bought this for my swimming pool to use as a timer and it just doesn’t stay connected. The dumb timer works way better than iHome product. I constantly removing it from power supply like tech supports says and few hours later it is disconnected. I have great WiFi signal outside by the pool and all my other apple HomeKit products are connected.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Downing

customer_reviews.title: Flawless smart plug
customer_reviews.text: I bought two to control my outdoor Christmas lights and they work perfectly. One unit is plugged in outside on the other side of my property and is still able to send/receive signals to my WiFi router — it's never disconnected nor needed a reset. Unlike other WiFi switches operating without a base station, the iHome smart plug doesn't make a high pitched noise when plugged into an outlet. Easy to set up, just scan the barcode and add it automatically to the iPhone's Home app. I'll be purchasing additional units. For those other reviewers having problems with it, fix your cheap WiFi network.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Great Homekit Device
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a few Homekit compatible devices and am slowly replacing my other non Homekit compatible devices, This simple outdoor outlet works great. The response time is instantaneous. It might be my quickest connecting device. I wouldn't really change anything design wise. The app works well, and Homekit app makes it even easier. I am using it on a schedule to turn on some outside flood lights.
customer_reviews.author: gEoFFTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Product quality
customer_reviews.text: Does not receive Wi-Fi unless it router is at close proximity. The Wi-Fi was within 10 ft. of the plug and it was a constant battle to keep it contact with it. Now I have gone to a updated more powerful Router that can project signals at greater distance, but the plug is still incapable of receiving signal and keeping updated. On another note, the time keeps changing without anyone changing it inside the program. I am very dissatisfied with this product. I think the company selling this product should try changing there software and performing an overhaul to the system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not ok.
customer_reviews.text: Dirty, repackaged, used device!!! Why did I pay more than retail for a used product??? Disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Ja Ja

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my outdoor Christmas lighting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this smart plug to automate my outdoor Christmas lights. It works great and I use it along side my indoor iHome smart plugs to manage and automate my Christmas scenes. They work concurrently with Siri and Alexa, and were easy to set up!
customer_reviews.author: SamuraiJack42

customer_reviews.title: 4 on my iPhone X and then everything worked fine. This plug has not failed since I installed ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a high pressure misting pump (it's hot here in AZ). I wish I knew that 2.4gHz is the standard for these items. I struggled with pairing until I called support, who told me to force 2.4 on my iPhone X and then everything worked fine. This plug has not failed since I installed about 30 days ago. i use Apple HomeKit to control it, so I cant speak for the iHome App on the iPhone. Te only reason I would not give it a 5 is because of the 2.4gHz info not being obvious when setting up.
customer_reviews.author: Dafried

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Apple HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup if you already use Apple HomeKit. Was also easy to integrate with Alexa. I spent hours with another similar wireless plug and it kept dropping internet connection and the Alexa setup was very confusing. Once setup Alexa only worked sporadically. I Recommend this for existing Apple HomeKit users.
customer_reviews.author: Aarika Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and also love having it work with Apple Home Kit. If you are in the process of trying to use wifi plugs and switches I highly suggest making sure that they work with whatever central home system you are using. Either iOS or Android. I didn't think about this when I first purchased my wifi plugs and now have three different apps to run mine. Its not the end of the world but its annoying.
customer_reviews.author: HR004

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work and nonexistent support
customer_reviews.text: The product listing doesn’t say anything about specific network requirements (2.4Ghz only, apparently, and who knows what else), and despite me actually having a 2.4Ghz band that’s working perfectly with all my other devices, this thing does nothing but throw the error “incompatible network (90)”. Unfortunately, their website has zero information on this error or any information about what the network requirements actually are so I could attempt to troubleshoot on my own, so I’m left with what amounts to an expensive brick. Instant return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I bought two of these last years about this time for holiday decorations. Used it for a couple of weeks then back in the box. This year it does not work. After several hours its “not responding” from HomeKit or the iHome app. Factory reset is no help.
customer_reviews.author: RJB101

customer_reviews.title: Looking for alternative switch
customer_reviews.text: I tried installing Alexa, it's a bit buggy, I'm not sure if it's the wifi or the software. The wifi seems laggy, you need to install it near to your wifi. Setting up the software make it complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Ray A

customer_reviews.title: Works well - good value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one at the beginning of December for my Christmas lights. It worked really well. I used it though the Apple HomeKit application and it was set to a timer within the app. Never had an issue and we all know how cold it got in the northwest. I’m using it again this summer to power on and off my fountains. For $40 it is a very good value. I’ve seen similar gadgets for 3x the price. If you’re into smart home, even in a small way and are looking to replace a timer and have much greater control of outdoor features (lights, fountains,...) then I highly recommend this device!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ISP100 Wifi Outdoor Smart Plug working for months no problems
customer_reviews.text: I use iHome ISP100 Wifi Outdoor Smart Plug to automate turning on and off ribbon lights along dark walkway during evening hours. It has been working without any problems for about 3 months. Never loses connection, turns off and on as specified within Apple iOS Home app. If needed I would definitely purchase another unit.
customer_reviews.author: Staeppan Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly with HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in 11/2017 to run my outdoor waterfall utilizing Apple HomeKit. This unit is a good 30’ from the house and has worked flawlessly since purchase. Once I got the easy set-up completed, and added it to my HomeKit system, it hasn’t came up with a “No Response” once. It works so well, I just purchased another one last month to run my outdoor string lights. I would recommend these smart plugs any day and everyday. A 2-outlet one would just be a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: GBPackerfan

customer_reviews.title: talk about a good value. I installed this in my low voltage ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, talk about a good value. I installed this in my low voltage outdoor lighting box and it works flawlessly. I am able to tell Alexa via Dot OR Siri via my iPhone to turn on/off my lights. Pretty snazzy!
customer_reviews.author: M&ROlsen

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup works great with homekit!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a cinch simple firmware update showed up in homekit right away. I think ihome’s firmware has gotten loads better over the last couple of years btw. I’ve got 6 original models of the isp5 all working great. This outdoor model isp100 will be great for the holidays!
customer_reviews.author: filmbuff?

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problems of buying things online is when they don’t work it is a hassle getting help to resolve the problem. Unlike a big box store where you can talk to them in person, when you buy online you are stuck with their online or phone support. And this is my beef with this company. I feel like a dog chasing his tail trying to use their support page.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great...
customer_reviews.text: Constantly disconnects from the cloud. Works great when it is connected but reconnecting every few weeks is a total PITA and an unnecessary amount of time wasted.
customer_reviews.author: shawn oshea

customer_reviews.title: Simple, works
customer_reviews.text: Simple outdoor device I use to control lighting and a couple of anti-freeze heaters. Connects easily, works reliably with Apple HomeKit, and functions dependably.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I am using it to control a landscape light transformer, auto on at sunset
customer_reviews.text: I am using this switch with IFTTT and Weatherundderground to control my outdoor lights. It works great. Turns them on at Sundown and off at 11:45pm
customer_reviews.author: R. Beck

customer_reviews.title: “Hey Siri, turn on the patio ambiance”
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I literally have zero complaints, the product feels solid, was easy to connect and has been working like a champ ever since. The range is good as well the WiFi spans the entire length of our house.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Was able to pair it with WiFi without any issue. This is not my first iHome and I don't have any issue so far. Works with Alexa. Don't have Hey Google so I can't say. Works with Apple Home as well.
customer_reviews.author: Allan L.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these from Amazon and the indoor IHome plugs from another retailer. They keep losing connection with the internet and you have to go around and unplug each one and wait for them to reset. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Olszewski

customer_reviews.title: No problems with super cold nights or snow
customer_reviews.text: I bought the outdoor plug for my 75+ yr old mom to control her outside Christmas lights. Set up took about 5 minutes and she was able to turn her outside lights on and off with her iphone's homekit or siri. did not work remotely when she wasn't home, but that was ok for her use. No problems with super cold nights or snow.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, not good for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it split. Less than a year after buying, the case split apart and rain and snow started seeping in. Not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: xboxremote

customer_reviews.title: frightened by the reviews and tried to cancel too late, surprisingly works regardless of reviews!
customer_reviews.text: I was in a rush so I wasn't able to check out reviews. Later I looked into the product and noticed how poor the reviews were, which made me try to cancel the order. Unfortunately, it was too late and it was shipped. It arrived and I set it up hoping it would work and it worked flawlessly. If it breaks I'll be sure to update my review, but so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: “No response” for HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: I have to reset these things at least twice a week. I’m using It on Apple HomeKit. They worked fine for a few months but now every couple days they come up as “no response” so I have to reset them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Worst "smart" product, support, and customer care we have ever experienced
customer_reviews.text: The product (iHome iSP 100) was inconsistent for the first few months as it periodically became detached from a strong and consistent WiFi signal. Then after 8 months it completely failed. Even though the device is still under warrantee, the support and customer care people insist that we return the device at our expense and want us to pay for a proper box, shipping & insurance. Do yourself a favor, and purchase a different manufacture's products.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Had a terrible time every couple of days trying to unlink and ...
customer_reviews.text: Never kept connection with wifi. Had a terrible time every couple of days trying to unlink and re-link it to google home. It's now in my junk drawer gathering dust, and a simple tonbux plug has taken its place. I'll just unplug it if we ever get rain in southern california.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Works effortlessly with Apple homekit 😃👍
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in, scanned code into Apple homekit, and had an automated scene in 2 minutes. Outdoor Holiday 🎄 lights now turn on and off by themselves. Great product, highly recommend. 👍😀
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: No resetting over and over with this one. It just works.
customer_reviews.text: The outdoor smart outlet that doesn't need resetting over and over....yep this is the one that actually worked like it was supposed to. Homekit and Siri are making it easy to use without learning a bunch of special commands.
customer_reviews.author: RVOnTheWayside

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects frequently.
customer_reviews.text: This plug disconnects at least once a week, and iHome’s ‘support’ saying just reset it a few times a week as the best option. They also said it’s because I need more bandwidth. Despite the fact that I have 240 Mbps up standing right next to the plug. Not helpful support and not a good plug.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy setup. HomeKit connected quickly and seems consistent
customer_reviews.text: Works well and easy setup. HomeKit connected quickly and seems consistent. This is outside and never is affected by bad weather. We also hooked it up to Amazon Alexa and that works great too.
customer_reviews.author: chamber

customer_reviews.title: Using to Control Pool Pump
customer_reviews.text: I have an above ground pool with a sand filter pump. The pump is on the far side of the poo some distance from the house and a power outlet. I simply run an extension cord to the pump. This allows me to turn on/off the pump without walking downstairs and outside. Both the app and the integration into my Google home worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Connected easily, works great with HomeKit. No issues with devicd
customer_reviews.author: Reviews from a guy

customer_reviews.title: 5 year old technology-avoid
customer_reviews.text: THE most archaic set process I’ve encountered. Is not compatible with Wink. I have 15+ Z wave products from 5 different manufactures-after spending nearly 2 hours attempting to pair -I’m done. Requires down load of third party app-for a light switch that is supposed to be compatible with Alexa and Wink-no way.
customer_reviews.author: PleasantinPerkasie

customer_reviews.title: Will not work
customer_reviews.text: The plug and it's android app are crap. I have tried every possible solution I could find online and tried the nonsensically written solution iHome tech support emailed to me to no avail. It will not connect no matter what. Total waste of money, kicking myself for not returning it sooner before I wasted hours of my life trying to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 11 months
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 11 months. It’s disappointing, thought I’d get at least two years.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Palumbo

customer_reviews.title: Stops responding to network requests...
customer_reviews.text: His device as well as many others are absolute trash! It was easy to set up and it worked for about 3 weeks and then it stopped "responding" to network requests. The manual switch works fine, but thats not the reason to have smart plugs in your home. It makes automating anything impossible.
customer_reviews.author: n.dude

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works well, only complaint is that it doesn't always stay connected to WiFi and Google Assistant says it is unavailable right now when the connection is lost. Overall it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Constantly loses WiFi connection
customer_reviews.text: This might be the most annoying smart plug I have ever purchased. Connects to my WiFi without problem. Plug is outside less than 50’ from my router yet every day it loses connection. Only recourse is to go outside, unplug and then plug it back in. Kind of defeats the purpose of a smart plug.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great HomeKit addition
customer_reviews.text: Great smart plug. We have it integrated with Apple HomeKit and it does exactly what we want. My only wish would be we could use it as a dimmer too.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable - needs constant rebooting
customer_reviews.text: I have found this thing to be totally useless. It will work fine for a while (measured in hours, not days). It seems to lose connectivity or have some other internal problem that causes it not to respond. I can get it to respond again by unplugging it and plugging it back in. I bought this so I could turn my Christmas lights on and off without having to go outside or when I'm away. The fact that it requires daily manual intervention totally defeats this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Got expensive
customer_reviews.text: It works well, but now $75 when it's used to be $35
customer_reviews.author: Bardia

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says: Works reliably with HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: Better than the similar $13 "remote control" device in that would still send a tiny bit of current to my outdoor lights for some reason. This device is OFF when it says it is off and it works great with my iOS-based home automation.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 of these. We used them to light up our backyard for parties and now are using them for holiday lights. These are so easy to pair with Homekit and the response time is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell C.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keeps dropping off the wifi every few days, requiring a hard reboot. Otherwise it works exactly as expected!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Did it’s job and quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say anything bad, this was out of the box and doing it’s job in minutes. Including an update to the device and downloading and registering for an ihome account. I can’t speak for Android, bit this thing synced with apple HomeKit instantly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Speidel

customer_reviews.title: A dead end
customer_reviews.text: Initially worked, now changed phones and cannot get the app to work (no device icon?, Cannot set up "home"). Yes I reinstalled and rebooted and rediscovered... Dead end No use if I cannot get it on the home network
customer_reviews.author: Jimbec

customer_reviews.title: Terrible purchase
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I ordered 2 of these and both stopped working after 24 hours!
customer_reviews.author: Donna L

customer_reviews.title: Read the product reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Stoped working less then one week.... Resetting device was time consuming with several failed attempts. When the reset or setup was successful the device only works for a short time, then same error.... “Unable to communicate with your accessory”..... This was the first time in a hurry... I didn’t read the product reviews.... Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Apple
customer_reviews.text: Used it for about a month to control some Christmas lights. Several rainy days did not affect performance. Always came on and off at the scheduled times.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Dome

customer_reviews.title: So far this has worked 100% perfectly for me. ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked 100% perfectly for me. Waited until this was in use for at least a month before I reviewed, zero issues thus far.
customer_reviews.author: RandomGuy

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Works great when ihome stays connected.. constantly needs to be rejoined/paired. Ihome wont see the device if my data is turned on. Ihome is great when it works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself pretty tech savvy, but for some reason, I cannot figure this setup out. I can't get my very strong WiFi signal to connect. Frankly, don't have the time to troubleshoot after already spending 2 hours. Not worth my time now. Maybe iHome can let me know what I'm doing wrong here and I'll change my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln Hawks

customer_reviews.title: Poor connectivity and poorer support
customer_reviews.text: The device keeps dropping off WiFi every 3 days and needs to be restarted. The device was sent for repair (manufacturer does not pay for shipping) and was returned after a month as having been repaired. The same issue still exists and have not heard back from the manufacturer on the follow up emails.
customer_reviews.author: Kishore Sundara-Rajan

customer_reviews.title: Fails to stay connected, stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy it. I'm tech savy. Connected right up, all seemed good. Played with it. Within 2 days it lost communication and wouldnt reconnect to save its life. My wifi and network was fine, the device was right there. Similar devices doing DHCP stayed connected. I should have read the reviews first. I dont think its worth returning.
customer_reviews.author: DailyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Not an iPhone user and had to program them with rules from an iPhone or iPad. The android app stinks. And the stupid things wont sync now to my router, ofc a month after I can return. Customer service is only 8-4 est m-f. And they have yet to address my issue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Coutee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my Christmas lights and it worked like a charm! Loved telling Alexa to turn on my lights and bam all of them on!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Despain

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Apple Homekit
customer_reviews.text: This works great and syncs very easily with Apple Homekit. We use this for outdoor string lights and leave it plugged into our outdoor electrical outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Android support
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this if you expect it to work with an android device. It does not work on recent versions of android, it may on older versions. Very disappointed, it isn't hard to keep an app up to date and working on old and new devices.
customer_reviews.author: g. ford

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box, hooked up to my pool filter and even can handle the amperage. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: RantsRoamer

customer_reviews.title: Great for automating exterior lights fountains and equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Apple HomeKit. I have 4 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to program and works well with my WI-fi. connected with Alexa with no problems for voice commands.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: I often had to disconnect and reconnect the smart plug myself in order for it to come back ...
customer_reviews.text: Often drops of my Home WiFi network, and does not re-establish properly. It was tough using this product, as I was using it for my outdoor Xmas Lights. I often had to disconnect and reconnect the smart plug myself in order for it to come back up, and at times, it took a day, or several hours for it to come back up.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Mein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm able to time my outdoor lights to the sun, and turn them on from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Nevins

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Have used it for Christmas lights and a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Have used it for Christmas lights and a Bug Zapper and have never had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Easy Home Kit Setup
customer_reviews.text: Great used it the entire Christmas Season without any issues. It was super quick to set up with Home Kit. I would buy more if needed.
customer_reviews.author: SubiTrek

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly in my HomeKit system.
customer_reviews.text: Switch is quite a ways away from my wireless router, and it works flawlessly. I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Texan632

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Will not work with Alexa as stated. Very dissapointed cannot seem to fine any outdoor plug that works with Alexa. Works great on its own app but I didn’t buy it for that function I bought it for using it with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: emchapman2

customer_reviews.title: Nice affordable smart plug
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to set up through the app and use in Apple Homekit. So far it's been working well outside is sub-freezing temperatures outside.
customer_reviews.author: timothy p walker

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a couple months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple months... now can no longer communicate with the Apple Home app... even after a factory reset. I think it’s just dead.
customer_reviews.author: B. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t ever respond.
customer_reviews.text: Returning the smart plug. It doesn’t ever respond. I have to manually turn it on and off. I wish I would have listened too all the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product, set up was a snap, we have them outside on some market lights for our fire pit area. Very easy to set up with HomeKit and program.
customer_reviews.author: Jerod Togger

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Now have 3 of these and they work great! Added to HomeKit for additional control through Siri. Connected low voltage landscape lighting (through a transformer) and connected cafe lights with second iHome switch.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect to Apple HomeKit. No problems with losing connection.
customer_reviews.author: 600rr

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay connected to HomeKit :(
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great product if only I didn’t have to reboot it daily to keep it working on HomeKit. The rest of my HomeKit devices work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the butt to setup, but once it get's going, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: bought 2 of these and two of a cheap Chinese brand. These two both lose connection every couple days, while the cheap Chinese brand always work.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Herron

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to be able to control my Christmas lights when I'm away from home. I put my lights up, plugged them all into a power strip, then plugged the power strip into the iHome, and it works perfectly. Setup took less than 3 minutes. Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Works great and integrates with Alexa easily
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for my deck lights. Integrates with Alexa, but you must enable the iHome skill first. Also, be patient as the firmware updates at first use.
customer_reviews.author: David Kuklewicz

customer_reviews.title: Love the convenience of not having to remember to turn off and on lights
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product set it up programmed times on and off with the home app on phone and all is forgotten.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: While this product was good while I had it for 2 months
customer_reviews.text: While this product was good while I had it for 2 months, it ended up not working and had to get a replacement model
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Use the product with Homekit. Setup was simple. Been using it outside to control string of patio lights for about a month now. I have had no experience with item dropping network connectivity. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Schick

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: sometimes doesn't work, but since last firmware update works ok.
customer_reviews.author: stuntech

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up, Quality Product & Priced Right
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Quick and easy set up. Materials have a quality look and feel. Works flawlessly with my Apple Watch and iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Macfan18

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it, until it suddenly quit
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 months, then wouldn’t connect to HomeKit
customer_reviews.author: Kirby Colas

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: It gets disconnected frequently - I have a very strong wifi signal at home (Google wifi w/ repeaters) - very frustrating and unreliable ...
customer_reviews.author: A. Afshary

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Xfinity wifi
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't believe that during set up, it said it wasn't compatible with my network!!! I have the latest modem from Xfinity, so it isn't some old wifi device. Waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

product_meta.title: iHome iSP100 Wifi Outdoor Smart Plug, Water Resistant, Works with Alexa, Google Assistant and Siri
product_meta.description: The home control iSP100 outdoor smart plug is made for easy control and scheduling for outdoor lighting, decorations, small appliances and more, up to 1800W. The iSP100 rugged outdoor design works with covered GFI enabled outdoor 120V power Supply. The iSP100 works with the broadest range of leading smart plug platforms, including Home Kit, Alexa, Google assistant, wink, and Nest allowing you to use your favorite apps to control the iSP100. Our broad platform support allows you to control the iSP100 via voice using Siri, Alexa and Google assistant.
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately)
Broadest smart home platform support, compatible with – Amazon Alexa, Google assistant, Apple home kit, IFTTT, SmartThings, Nest, wink
Broadest smart home platform support, compatible with Apple home kit, Nest, smart things, wink, Amazon Alexa and Google assistant
Global remote access. 24/7 control and notifications with home's highly secure and encrypted data and privacy protection.
Designed with 6” outdoor power cord for convenient use with outdoor GFI covered outlets

Wi-Fi enabled wall plug lets you control small appliances using 1800 watts or under, great for controlling lights, window air conditioners, fans, portable heaters, coffee makers, home audio systems and more

specifications.Special Features: Rugged water resistant plug for outdoor use Easy set up
specifications.Included Components: Outdoor Apple HomeKit Wi-Fi Smart Plug
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars285 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
